intro: Elytranthe krempfii, commonly known as the velvetleaf geranium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive velvety leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and prominent stamens. Elytranthe krempfii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
